name: InterContinental Real Metrocentro Managua

reviews.text: I stayed at the IC in Managua the night of April 1 and paid $50 for an upgrade to the Club floor. Upon entering my room I noticed a typewritten note from the manager saying that the club restaurant and bar were closed for the week. When I asked for a refund at the front desk, they refused. That will be the last time I ever stay at an IC.
reviews.title: Not good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are "world travelers" and thought this was absolutely one of the best ever! Stayed on
reviews.title: Best hotel in Central America

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the Executive floor and check in was smooth as silk, cocktails & hors dourves every evening,
reviews.title: GOOD QUALITY INTERCONTINENTAL

reviews.text: "gourmet" type breakfast every morning - pool area - magnificent, absolutely fantastic
reviews.title: Business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: staff - Scarlett in Exec. Lounge in the evening, Deyeby serves breakfast in the lounge in the
reviews.title: Typical Big Box Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here as part of a very large wedding group during a sold out weekend. First, the good as it is a nice hotel - in general, very nice staff that try, nice sized and clean rooms, good location, good restaurant, decent pool (small though), Normally I would be pleased.
reviews.title: Typical business hotel made me feel awkward

reviews.text: What bugged me was the check in. First, she did not take the credit card I wanted to use as it was a modern card without the raised letters and she wanted to run a blank voucher for my signature. I see this requirement as well in some provincial provinces at home and it sets a real third world impression. A good friend said she was told her card was declined and the front desk refused to call for her as she insisted she used it at the airport to buy water. She then did an act and pretended to get her other Amex from her purse and handed it back to reception and it worked.
reviews.title: Mediocre at best

reviews.text: Worse, I had reserved a king bed for my partner and I and she questioned this numerous times and then could not find any room for us that was ready and told us we had to wait. I sat inthe lobby using the expensive internet and wached at least 20 people, many from same wedding, get keys immediately. I then went to complain and the desk manager apologized and said, yes, we have rooms available. I finally got a room with two beds. I am in my room now and feel uncomfortable. It is the first time in many years that I have felt the victim of homophobic prejudice at a first class hotel anywhere in the world. I am glad to be leaving after a quck weekend and will never come back. I hope it was just that one receptionist who is so terrible. Everyone else at the hotel has been first class. At the very least, this hotel needs to seriously get its front desk staff in training.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: Just got back from 4 days in Nica. For a business hotel this would be just fine ok but for leisure travelers this hotel falls short of providing any special touches or foresight into travelers' needs. I travel extensively internationally for work and have stayed at intercontinental hotels so was very disappointed by this one in Managua.
reviews.title: It's all you'd expect from an Intercontinental hotel

reviews.text: We paid for breakfast to include on our bill and we were charged anyway.
reviews.title: very comfortable business & leisure hotel - great value

reviews.text: It was an eye opeing experience in Nicaragua. The Intercontinental provides a safe enviroment and makes you feel like you are in a compound. Staff is friendly and accomodations nice.
reviews.title: Interesting Trip

reviews.text: Simply wonderful escape from the hectic city of Managua...as usual the terrific linens and inroom amenities; a special touch a phone greeting from Hans the GM...Central location , next to a mall, but I strongly recommend a cab for visiting nearby resturants
reviews.title: Great Intercontential

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only objection here is and some other major hotel chains is they still charge for internet...up to $20/day...They should ammend this policy
reviews.title: A nice choice in Managua

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Room was very attractive. Public areas were pleasant and well-furnished. The pool area was nice. We had lunch in the restaurant and felt that the food and service were good. Main desk personnel were pleasant and accommodating. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Once again - Great Managua Hotel

reviews.text: I have now stayed at this hotel over a dozen times and continue to be impressed. Service is great, the hotel is lovely and dining in the restaurant in the morning is outstanding!! The breakfast buffet is incredible, one of the best breakfasts of any hotel anywhere. It is quite expensive however if you have to pay, about $20 USD, that is a bit excessive but well, probably worth it if you are a big breakfast eater.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Naturally, in a country where ordering lunch, receiving and paying for it takes two hours, you can't expect fast check-in. But the front desk was a very model of chaos and disorganization when our group checked in the other day. Hot and muddy from a volcano climb, a bus ride, and sightseeing, we were anxious to hit the the rooms. Not gonna happen. Fortunately, or unfortunately depending on your view, I can be a little...forthright and direct. I got the clan (8 rooms) upgraded to the eighth floor suddenly. Yes, I can be a little brusque and unpleasant but as a dedicated hotel rat with years of living in and out of hotels, at least I leave a tip for the maid and am generous with bellboys, concierges and waiters. Rooms are very nice, hot water abundant, the mall and its dubious pleasures across the street (ditto the ubiquitous Gentlemen's Lounge.) Breakfast not cheap but I thought worth the ease -- but you can buy anything across the street, hit the ATM, the grocery, etc. Stayed twice on this trip and would stay again if in Managua. Probably.
reviews.title: Yes, but...5 PM and you say the room's not ready?

reviews.text: I've stayed in several hotels in Managua, I prefer this one. Its location allows you to safely visit the mall on foot and therefore allows you to do some shopping and get a fast bite to eat with out having to use a taxi. There are also many other dining options near by so you can get something other than hotel food. Rooms are nice, just as at most central american Intercon. Nice toiletries, comfortable beds and a decent sized bathroom. The staff is firendly and the cleaning service is great. they always make you room feel clean and tidy. I would recommend this hotel to all travelers, but especially business travelers.
reviews.title: Great location in Managua

reviews.text: I stayed three night, it is the best Intercontinteal I ever stayed. Rooms were simply perfect, modern fitted and really confortable, mattresses are state-of.the-art.
reviews.title: Best Place in Town

reviews.text: Reception is professional and friendly as well. The atmoshere in the hotel is very relaxed, very calm and all the people yon can meet are very gently and helping in case of problem.
reviews.title: My home in Nicaragua

reviews.text: I personally enjoed a lot the external pool well mantained and large enough.
reviews.title: International Business Travelers Stay Away

description: THE PLACE TO BE. Enjoy an urban oasis at this award-winning, luxury hotel in Managua, Nicaragua. Ideally placed in the center of the entertainment and business district, adjacent to the country's largest shopping mall featuring more than 120 stores. Indulge yourself at Factory Streak & Lobster, enjoy a trendy ambience at NAU lounge bar or unwind in the tranquil surrounding at our terrace next to the pool and exotic gardens. Explore the city, visit Managua's famous Cathedral and its historic downtown area.
